t: Amazon quietly launches exclusive OTC product line: 7 things to know
s: Amazon quietly launched Basic Care, an exclusive line of 60 over-the-counter healthcare products, in August — a move that could place more pressure on pharmacy retail chains, reports CNBC.

t: Will Amazon's Basic Care OTC Line Disrupt the Market?
s: March 5, 2021 - The online retailing giant has its own brand of nonprescription drugs. Can it compete? Without much fanfare, Amazon recently launched a line of generic OTC medications called Basic Care.1 This line will compete with Giant Eagle's TopCare, Target's Up & Up, and Walmart's Equate brands.

t: Amazon selling private-label medications | Retail Dive
s: February 21, 2018 - Amazon is selling an exclusive line of over-the-counter medications and health care items in a further challenge to traditional drugstore retailers, CNBC reports. Basic Care is an exclusive brand on Amazon though not owned by Amazon, an Amazon spokesperson told Retail Dive.
